Description: Fragment of a cornice belonging to a marble Ionic cyma with sepal and dart. In the middle part of the small fragment a convex roll is preserved and parts of a spiral tendril on the left side that could possibly belong to the spirals of the previous fragment B 426. The fragment is made of light grey marble.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Apollo (Naukratis) (Attributed by Petrie to the 'second temple of Apollo'.)
Curator's comments: Previously published and labelled as GR1886,0401.63, however 63 is an inscription. The convex roll refers to a similar corner piece. The profile and the sepal correspond with B 426 and confirm style of the cyma as Ionic. Published (Koenigs 2007, 330 Cat. 16; Altekamp 136ff. No. 1, Blattstab A. Fig. 124)
Bibliographic references: Sculpture / Catalogue of Greek Sculpture in the British Museum (B430)
Koenigs 2007 / Archaische griechische Bauteile (Cat. no.16, p.330, pl. 16-17)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (AA.25) (Phase 3)
